title: First State National Historical Park: Planning
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning            Planning      Â      Visitors enjoy a picnic on the Brandywine.   Management planning for First State National Historical Park began in September with three identical Community Information Sessions.  Park and Regional Office staff reviewed progress on the park to date and asked attendees to share their visions for the park's future.  Sessions were held at the following times and locations: September 15 - Blue Ball Barn, Hay Room, Alapocas Run State Park, Wilmington, DE 7-9pm. September 16 - Old State House, The Green, Dover, DE, 1-3pm. September 23 - New Castle Presbyterian Church, Fellowship Hall, New Castle, DE 7-9pm. November 5 - Brandywine Conservancy, 1 Hoffman's Mill Rd., Chadds Ford, PA 19317. In addition, Park staff gathered ideas at the Vive Tu Vida! health event in Kennett Square on September 27. Please click here to enter your ideas and observations concerning the future of the park.
